intro: Antidesma platyphyllum var. hamakuaense, commonly known as the Hamakua antidesma, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and coastal areas. It produces small, orange-red fruits that are an important food source for native birds and insects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
